title: Reduce LandingHeader height by 20% across breakpoints

requirements.summary: Reduce the fixed LandingHeader min-height by ~20% on base and md breakpoints and scale the logo height proportionally while keeping navigation and scroll offset behavior intact.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/LandingHeader.tsx, the headerâ€™s primary container min-height values are reduced by ~20% for both base and md breakpoints (currently min-h-[220px] and md:min-h-[260px]).
The logo image height values are reduced by ~20% for both base and md breakpoints (currently h-[200px] and md:h-[240px]) so the logo remains visually balanced within the smaller header.
On mobile and desktop, the header remains fixed, navigation buttons remain visible and clickable, and the mobile menu open/close behavior still works.
Clicking navigation items still scrolls to the correct section with appropriate offset (no section titles hidden behind the header).

file_operations.description: Reduce the header container Tailwind min-height utilities by ~20% for base and md breakpoints (e.g., min-h-[220px] -> ~min-h-[176px], md:min-h-[260px] -> ~md:min-h-[208px]) and reduce the logo img height utilities proportionally (e.g., h-[200px] -> ~h-[160px], md:h-[240px] -> ~md:h-[192px]) while leaving structure, fixed positioning, and menu toggling logic unchanged; ensure nav click handlers still close mobile menu and keep all interactive elements visible/clickable.
